articles.title: –†–æ—Å—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∏–π —Å–ª–µ–Ω–≥ –¥–ª—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏: –Ø–∫ —Å–ø—ñ–ª–∫—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è –∑ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–æ–º –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–†–æ—Å—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∏–π —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-—Å–ª–µ–Ω–≥ —Ç–∞ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–∂—É—Ç—å –≤–∞–º –∫—Ä–∞—â–µ —Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—Ç–∏ –ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–æ–º–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è –≤–∞—à–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ —Ç–∞ –ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç–∏ –±—ñ–ª—å—à –ø—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ.

## –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤—ñ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–ü—Ä–∏–≤"
  translation="–ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç"
  pronunciation="–ø—Ä—ñ–≤"
  context="–°–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è –¥–ª—è –Ω–µ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—ó –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏."
/>

### –ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—â–∞–Ω–Ω—è

<VocabCard
  word="–ü—Ä–∏–≤ / –ü—Ä–∏–≤–∫–∏"
  translation="–ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç"
  pronunciation="–ø—Ä—ñ–≤ / –ø—Ä—ñ–≤-–∫—ñ"
  example="–ü—Ä–∏–≤, –∫–∞–∫ –¥–µ–ª–∞? üòä (–ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç, —è–∫ —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏?)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ó–¥–∞—Ä–æ–≤/–ó–¥–∞—Ä–æ–≤–∞"
  translation="–ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç (–Ω–µ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ)"
  pronunciation="–∑–¥–∞-—Ä–æ–≤/–∑–¥–∞-—Ä–æ-–≤–∞"
  example="–ó–¥–∞—Ä–æ–≤–∞! –ß—ë –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—à—å? (–ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç! –©–æ —Ä–æ–±–∏—à?)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ü–æ–∫–∞/–ü–æ–∫–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞"
  translation="–ë—É–≤–∞–π"
  pronunciation="–ø–∞-–∫–∞/–ø–∞-–∫—î-–¥–æ-–≤–∞"
  example="–ü–æ–∫–∞, —É–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–æ–º! (–ë—É–≤–∞–π, –ø–æ–±–∞—á–∏–º–æ—Å—å –≤–≤–µ—á–µ—Ä—ñ!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ë–ë / –ë–±"
  translation="–ë–∞–π-–±–∞–π"
  pronunciation="–±—ñ-–±—ñ"
  example="–õ–∞–¥–Ω–æ, –±–±! üíï (–î–æ–±—Ä–µ, –±—É–≤–∞–π!)"
/>

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è

<VocabCard
  word="–õ—é"
  translation="–õ—é–±–ª—é (—Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–æ)"
  pronunciation="–ª—é"
  example="–õ—é —Ç–µ–±—è! üíó (–õ—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±–µ!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–õ—Ç / –õ—é —Ç—è"
  translation="–õ—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±—è"
  pronunciation="–ª-—Ç / –ª—é —Ç—è"
  example="–°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏, –ª—Ç! üíï (–ù–∞ –¥–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, –ª—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±–µ!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–°–∫—É—á"
  translation="–°–∫—É—á–∞—é"
  pronunciation="—Å–∫—É—á"
  example="–°–∫—É—á üò¢ –ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–¥—ë—à—å? (–°—É–º—É—é. –ö–æ–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–π–¥–µ—à?)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ß–º–æ–∫/–ß–º–æ–∫–∏"
  translation="–¶—å–æ–º/–¶—å–æ–º–∫–∏"
  pronunciation="—á–º–æ–∫/—á–º–æ-–∫—ñ"
  example="–°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏, —á–º–æ–∫–∏! üòò (–ù–∞ –¥–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, —Ü—å–æ–º!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–¶–µ–ª—É—é"
  translation="–¶—ñ–ª—É—é"
  pronunciation="—Ü–µ-–ª—É-—é"
  example="–£–∂–µ –µ–¥—É, —Ü–µ–ª—É—é! (–í–∂–µ —ó–¥—É, —Ü—ñ–ª—É—é!)"
/>

<CultureTip title="–°–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –≤ —Ä–æ—Å—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å—Ü—ñ" flag="üá∑üá∫">
–†–æ—Å—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∏–π —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-—Å–ª–µ–Ω–≥ –¥—É–∂–µ —Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π. ¬´–°–ø—Å¬ª –∑–∞–º—ñ—Å—Ç—å ¬´—Å–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ¬ª, ¬´–ø–∂–ª¬ª –∑–∞–º—ñ—Å—Ç—å ¬´–ø–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞¬ª, ¬´–ª–∞–Ω¬ª –∑–∞–º—ñ—Å—Ç—å ¬´–ª–∞–¥–Ω–æ¬ª. –¶–µ –µ–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–∏—Ç—å —á–∞—Å —ñ –≤–∏–≥–ª—è–¥–∞—î –±—ñ–ª—å—à –Ω–µ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ.
</CultureTip>

## –ü–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–∏–π —Å–ª–µ–Ω–≥

### –ü–æ–∑–∏—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ñ –≤–∏—Ä–∞–∑–∏

<VocabCard
  word="–ö—Ä—É—Ç–æ/–ö—Ä—É—Ç—è–∫"
  translation="–ö—Ä—É—Ç–æ"
  pronunciation="–∫—Ä—É-—Ç–æ/–∫—Ä—É-—Ç—è–∫"
  example="–ö—Ä—É—Ç–æ! –ñ–¥—É –Ω–µ –¥–æ–∂–¥—É—Å—å! (–ö—Ä—É—Ç–æ! –ù–µ –º–æ–∂—É –¥–æ—á–µ–∫–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–ª–∞—Å—Å–Ω–æ/–ö–ª–∞—Å—Å"
  translation="–ö–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ"
  pronunciation="–∫–ª–∞—Å-–Ω–∞/–∫–ª–∞—Å"
  example="–ö–ª–∞—Å—Å! –£–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è –≤ 8! (–ö–ª–∞—Å! –ü–æ–±–∞—á–∏–º–æ—Å—å –æ 8!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–û—Ñ–∏–≥–µ–Ω–Ω–æ"
  translation="–û—Ñ—ñ–≥–µ–Ω–Ω–æ (–∫—Ä—É—Ç–æ)"
  pronunciation="–∞-—Ñ—ñ-–≥—î–Ω-–Ω–∞"
  example="–≠—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –æ—Ñ–∏–≥–µ–Ω–Ω–æ! (–¶–µ –±—É–ª–æ –æ—Ñ—ñ–≥–µ–Ω–Ω–æ!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–°—É–ø–µ—Ä/–°—É–ø—á–∏–∫"
  translation="–°—É–ø–µ—Ä"
  pronunciation="—Å—É-–ø–µ—Ä/—Å—É–ø-—á—ñ–∫"
  example="–°—É–ø–µ—Ä, –¥–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∏—Å—å! (–°—É–ø–µ—Ä, –¥–æ–º–æ–≤–∏–ª–∏—Å—è!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–í–∞—â–µ"
  translation="–í–∑–∞–≥–∞–ª—ñ (–≤ —Å–µ–Ω—Å—ñ ¬´–∫—Ä—É—Ç–æ¬ª)"
  pronunciation="–≤–∞-—â–µ"
  example="–¢—ã –≤–∞—â–µ –ª—É—á—à–∞—è! (–¢–∏ –≤–∑–∞–≥–∞–ª—ñ –Ω–∞–π–∫—Ä–∞—â–∞!)"
/>

### –ù–µ–≥–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ñ —Ç–∞ –Ω–µ–π—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="–§–∏–≥ –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç"
  translation="–•—Ç–æ –π–æ–≥–æ –∑–Ω–∞"
  pronunciation="—Ñ—ñ–≥ –∑–Ω–∞-—î—Ç"
  example="–ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–æ? - –§–∏–≥ –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç. (–ö–æ–ª–∏ –±—É–¥–µ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–æ? - –•—Ç–æ –π–æ–≥–æ –∑–Ω–∞.)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ù—É —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ"
  translation="–¢–∞–∫ —Å–æ–±—ñ"
  pronunciation="–Ω—É —Ç–∞-–∫–æ-—î"
  example="–ö–∞–∫ —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º? - –ù—É —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ. (–Ø–∫ —Ñ—ñ–ª—å–º? - –¢–∞–∫ —Å–æ–±—ñ.)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–°–µ—Ä—å—ë–∑–Ω–æ?"
  translation="–°–µ—Ä–π–æ–∑–Ω–æ?"
  pronunciation="—Å—î—Ä—å-–π–æ–∑-–Ω–∞"
  example="–°–µ—Ä—å—ë–∑–Ω–æ?! –ù–µ –≤–µ—Ä—é! (–°–µ—Ä–π–æ–∑–Ω–æ?! –ù–µ –≤—ñ—Ä—é!)"
/>

## –°–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –¥–ª—è —â–æ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω–∏—Ö –ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–æ–º–ª–µ–Ω—å

| –°–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è | –ü–æ–≤–Ω–∞ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ |
|------------|-------------|------------|
| –°–ø—Å | –°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ | –î—è–∫—É—é |
| –ü–∂–ª | –ü–æ–∂–∞–ª—É–π—Å—Ç–∞ | –ë—É–¥—å –ª–∞—Å–∫–∞ |
| –õ–∞–Ω | –õ–∞–¥–Ω–æ | –î–æ–±—Ä–µ |
| –©–∞ | –°–µ–π—á–∞—Å | –ó–∞—Ä–∞–∑ |
| –ù–æ—Ä–º | –ù–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ | –ù–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ |
| –•–∑ | –•—Ä–µ–Ω –∑–Ω–∞–µ—Ç | –•—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞ |
| –ö—Å—Ç | –ö—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏ | –î–æ —Ä–µ—á—ñ |
| –ò–º—Ö–æ | –ü–æ –º–æ–µ–º—É –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—é | –ù–∞ –º–æ—é –¥—É–º–∫—É |

<VocabCard
  word="–°–ø—Å –∑–∞ –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä"
  translation="–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä"
  pronunciation="—Å–ø—Å –∑–∞ –≤—î-—á–µ—Ä"
  example="–°–ø—Å –∑–∞ –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä! –ë—ã–ª–æ –∫—Ä—É—Ç–æ üíï (–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä! –ë—É–ª–æ –∫—Ä—É—Ç–æ)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–©–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–¥—É"
  translation="–ó–∞—Ä–∞–∑ –ø—Ä–∏–π–¥—É"
  pronunciation="—â–∞ –ø—Ä—ñ-–¥—É"
  example="–ü–æ–¥–æ–∂–¥–∏, —â–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–¥—É! (–ü–æ—á–µ–∫–∞–π, –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑ –ø—Ä–∏–π–¥—É!)"
/>

## –ï–º–æ—Ü—ñ–π–Ω—ñ –≤–∏—Ä–∞–∑–∏

<VocabCard
  word="–ê–∞–∞/–ê–∞–∞–∞–∞"
  translation="–ê–∞–∞ (–µ–º–æ—Ü—ñ—è)"
  pronunciation="–∞-–∞-–∞"
  example="–ê–∞–∞, —Ç—ã –ª—É—á—à–∏–π! ü•∞ (–ê–∞–∞, —Ç–∏ –Ω–∞–π–∫—Ä–∞—â–∏–π!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–û—Ä—É"
  translation="–°–º—ñ—à–Ω–æ (–±—É–∫–≤–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ ¬´–∫—Ä–∏—á—É¬ª)"
  pronunciation="–∞-—Ä—É"
  example="–û—Ä—É üòÇ –≠—Ç–æ —Å–º–µ—à–Ω–æ! (–°–º—ñ—à–Ω–æ! –¶–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∫–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ñ–∏–∑–∞"
  translation="–ñ–∏—Ç—Ç—î–≤–æ (–ø—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞ –∂–∏—Ç—Ç—è)"
  pronunciation="–∂—ñ-–∑–∞"
  example="–≠—Ç–æ –∂–∏–∑–∞ üòÖ (–¶–µ –∂–∏—Ç—Ç—î–≤–æ)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–†–∂—É"
  translation="–°–º—ñ—é—Å—è"
  pronunciation="—Ä–∂—É"
  example="–†–∂—É –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É üòÇ (–°–º—ñ—é—Å—è –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂—É)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ú–∏–ª–æ—Ç–∞"
  translation="–ú–∏–ª–æ—Ç–∞"
  pronunciation="–º—ñ-–ª–æ-—Ç–∞"
  example="–ê–≤–≤–≤, —ç—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–∞—è –º–∏–ª–æ—Ç–∞! ü•∞ (–ê–≤–≤, —Ü–µ —Ç–∞–∫–∞ –º–∏–ª–æ—Ç–∞!)"
/>

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ –ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–æ–º–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è

### –†–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∫–æ, —Å–æ–ª–Ω—ã—à–∫–æ ‚òÄÔ∏è"
  translation="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–Ω–∫—É, —Å–æ–Ω–µ—á–∫–æ"
  pronunciation="–¥–æ–±-—Ä–∞-—î —É-—Ç—Ä—î—á-–∫–∞ —Å–æ–ª-–Ω–∏—à-–∫–∞"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∫–æ, —Å–æ–ª–Ω—ã—à–∫–æ! –ö–∞–∫ —Å–ø–∞–ª–æ—Å—å? (–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–Ω–∫—É, —Å–æ–Ω–µ—á–∫–æ! –Ø–∫ —Å–ø–∞–ª–æ—Å—è?)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ü—Ä–æ—Å–Ω—É–ª–∞—Å—å –∏ —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É –æ —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  translation="–ü—Ä–æ–∫–∏–Ω—É–ª–∞—Å—è —ñ –æ–¥—Ä–∞–∑—É –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  pronunciation="–ø—Ä–∞—Å-–Ω—É-–ª–∞—Å—å —ñ —Å—Ä–∞-–∑—É –∞ —Ç–µ-–±—î"
  example="–ü—Ä–æ—Å–Ω—É–ª–∞—Å—å –∏ —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É –æ —Ç–µ–±–µ –ø–æ–¥—É–º–∞–ª–∞ üíï (–ü—Ä–æ–∫–∏–Ω—É–ª–∞—Å—è —ñ –æ–¥—Ä–∞–∑—É –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ –ø–æ–¥—É–º–∞–ª–∞)"
/>

### –ü—Ä–æ—Ç—è–≥–æ–º –¥–Ω—è

<VocabCard
  word="–î—É–º–∞—é –æ —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  translation="–î—É–º–∞—é –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  pronunciation="–¥—É-–º–∞-—é –∞ —Ç–µ-–±—î"
  example="–ù–∞ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ, –Ω–æ –¥—É–º–∞—é –æ —Ç–µ–±–µ üí≠ (–ù–∞ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç—ñ, –∞–ª–µ –¥—É–º–∞—é –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ñ–¥—É –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏"
  translation="–ß–µ–∫–∞—é –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á—ñ"
  pronunciation="–∂–¥—É –≤—Å—Ç—Ä—î-—á—ñ"
  example="–ñ–¥—É –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏! –£–∂–µ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ ü•∞ (–ß–µ–∫–∞—é –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á—ñ! –í–∂–µ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ)"
/>

### –í–µ—á—ñ—Ä–Ω—ñ

<VocabCard
  word="–°–ø–æ–∫–∏, —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤ üåô"
  translation="–ù–∞ –¥–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, —Å–æ–ª–æ–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω—ñ–≤"
  pronunciation="—Å–ø–æ-–∫—ñ —Å–ª–∞–¥-–∫—ñ—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤"
  example="–°–ø–æ–∫–∏, –ª—é–±–∏–º—ã–π. –°–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤ üíï (–ù–∞ –¥–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–π. –°–æ–ª–æ–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω—ñ–≤)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–¢—ã –º–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏—Å–Ω–∏—à—å—Å—è"
  translation="–¢–∏ –º–µ–Ω—ñ –Ω–∞—Å–Ω–∏—à—Å—è"
  pronunciation="—Ç–∏ –º–Ω—î –ø—Ä—ñ-—Å–Ω—ñ—à-—Å—è"
  example="–°–ø–æ–∫–∏. –ó–Ω–∞—é, —á—Ç–æ —Ç—ã –º–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏—Å–Ω–∏—à—å—Å—è üåü (–ù–∞ –¥–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á. –ó–Ω–∞—é, —â–æ —Ç–∏ –º–µ–Ω—ñ –Ω–∞—Å–Ω–∏—à—Å—è)"
/>

<CultureTip title="–ï–º–æ–¥–∑—ñ –≤ —Ä–æ—Å—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å—Ü—ñ" flag="üá∑üá∫">
–†–æ—Å—ñ—è–Ω–∏ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—é—Ç—å –µ–º–æ–¥–∑—ñ —Ç–∞ —Å—Ç—ñ–∫–µ—Ä–∏ –≤ –º–µ—Å–µ–Ω–¥–∂–µ—Ä–∞—Ö. ‚ù§Ô∏è üíï üòò ü•∞ ‚Äî –Ω–∞–π–ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ñ—à—ñ –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ—ó –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏. Telegram-—Å—Ç—ñ–∫–µ—Ä–∏ ‚Äî –æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤–∞ —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–∞ —Ä–æ—Å—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–æ—ó —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-–∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–∏!
</CultureTip>

## –°—É—á–∞—Å–Ω–∏–π –º–æ–ª–æ–¥—ñ–∂–Ω–∏–π —Å–ª–µ–Ω–≥

<VocabCard
  word="–ö—Ä–∏–Ω–∂"
  translation="–ö—Ä–∏–Ω–∂ (—â–æ—Å—å –Ω–µ–∑—Ä—É—á–Ω–µ)"
  pronunciation="–∫—Ä—ñ–Ω–∂"
  example="–≠—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª –∫—Ä–∏–Ω–∂ üò¨ (–¶–µ –±—É–≤ –∫—Ä–∏–Ω–∂)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–í–∞–π–±"
  translation="–í–∞–π–± (–∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞)"
  pronunciation="–≤–∞–π–±"
  example="–¢—É—Ç —Ç–∞–∫–æ–π –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–Ω—ã–π –≤–∞–π–±! (–¢—É—Ç —Ç–∞–∫–∞ –∫–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∞ –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ò–∑–∏"
  translation="–õ–µ–≥–∫–æ"
  pronunciation="—ñ-–∑—ñ"
  example="–î–∞ —ç—Ç–æ –∏–∑–∏! (–¢–∞ —Ü–µ –ª–µ–≥–∫–æ!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–†–æ—Ñ–ª"
  translation="–ñ–∞—Ä—Ç/–ü—Ä–∏–∫–æ–ª"
  pronunciation="—Ä–æ—Ñ–ª"
  example="–≠—Ç–æ —Ä–æ—Ñ–ª —á—Ç–æ –ª–∏? (–¶–µ –∂–∞—Ä—Ç —á–∏ —â–æ?)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ß–∏–ª/–ß–∏–ª–∏—Ç—å"
  translation="–í—ñ–¥–ø–æ—á–∏–≤–∞—Ç–∏"
  pronunciation="—á—ñ–ª/—á—ñ-–ª—ñ—Ç—å"
  example="–î–∞–≤–∞–π –ø–æ—á–∏–ª–∏–º –¥–æ–º–∞? (–î–∞–≤–∞–π –≤—ñ–¥–ø–æ—á–∏–Ω–µ–º–æ –≤–¥–æ–º–∞?)"
/>

## –ü—Ä–∏–∫–ª–∞–¥–∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏

### –ü–ª–∞–Ω—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –ø–æ–±–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è

```
–û–Ω–∞: –ü—Ä–∏–≤–∫–∏, —á—Ç–æ –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—à—å –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–æ–º? üòä
–û–Ω: –ü—Ä–∏–≤, –ª—é–±–∏–º–∞—è! –ù–∏—á–µ–≥–æ, –∞ —á—Ç–æ?
–û–Ω–∞: –ü–æ–π–¥—ë–º –Ω–∞ —É–∂–∏–Ω? –•–æ—á—É —Å—É—à–∏ üç£
```

### –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–π –¥—ñ–∞–ª–æ–≥

```
–û–Ω–∞: –ü—Ä–∏–≤–∫–∏, –º–∏–ª—ã–π! –ö–ª–∞—Å—Å–Ω–æ, —Ç—ã —Å–Ω–∏–ª—Å—è üòä
```

## –®–≤–∏–¥–∫–∏–π —Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω–∏–∫ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω—å

articles.title: Frases de Paquera em Franc√™s: A Arte de Seduzir √† la Fran√ßaise
articles.content:
O franc√™s √© universalmente reconhecido como a l√≠ngua do amor. Paris, a cidade-luz, √© o destino rom√¢ntico por excel√™ncia, e dominar algumas frases de paquera em franc√™s pode transformar qualquer momento em uma cena de filme rom√¢ntico.

## O Charme Inconfund√≠vel do Franc√™s

H√° algo na sonoridade do franc√™s que naturalmente evoca romance. A melodia suave, os sons nasais caracter√≠sticos e a eleg√¢ncia natural da l√≠ngua fazem com que at√© frases simples soem sedutoras.

## Frases Essenciais de Paquera

### Elogios Sofisticados

**Tu es vraiment magnifique ce soir.**
*Voc√™ est√° realmente magn√≠fica esta noite.*

"Magnifique" √© mais forte que "belle" ou "jolie" - reserve para momentos em que a pessoa realmente tirou seu f√¥lego.

**J'adore ton sourire.**
*Eu adoro seu sorriso.*

Simples, elegante e sempre bem-recebido. O verbo "adorer" carrega mais intensidade que "aimer bien".

**Tu as des yeux incroyables.**
*Voc√™ tem olhos incr√≠veis.*

Os franceses apreciam elogios espec√≠ficos. Mencionar os olhos √© um cl√°ssico que sempre funciona.

### Expressando Interesse

**Je ne peux pas m'emp√™cher de penser √† toi.**
*N√£o consigo evitar pensar em voc√™.*

Rom√¢ntica e vulner√°vel, esta frase mostra que a pessoa domina seus pensamentos.

**Tu me fais craquer.**
*Voc√™ me faz derreter.*

Express√£o idiom√°tica francesa que significa que voc√™ n√£o consegue resistir √† pessoa. Muito usada e aut√™ntica.

**Il y a quelque chose de sp√©cial chez toi.**
*H√° algo especial em voc√™.*

Misteriosa e intrigante, perfeita para criar tens√£o rom√¢ntica.

### Cantadas √† la Fran√ßaise

**Est-ce que ton p√®re est voleur? Parce qu'il a vol√© les √©toiles pour les mettre dans tes yeux.**
*Seu pai √© ladr√£o? Porque ele roubou as estrelas para colocar nos seus olhos.*

Cl√°ssica e um pouco brega, mas entregue com charme franc√™s, funciona!

**Tu dois √™tre fatigu√©e, parce que tu as couru dans ma t√™te toute la journ√©e.**
*Voc√™ deve estar cansada, porque correu na minha cabe√ßa o dia todo.*

Divertida e leve, boa para quebrar o gelo.

**Je crois que je suis perdu(e). Tu peux me montrer le chemin vers ton c≈ìur?**
*Acho que estou perdido(a). Voc√™ pode me mostrar o caminho at√© seu cora√ß√£o?*

Rom√¢ntica com um toque de humor.

### Para Relacionamentos

**Chaque moment avec toi est pr√©cieux.**
*Cada momento com voc√™ √© precioso.*

Ideal para manter a chama viva em relacionamentos estabelecidos.

**Tu es mon √¢me s≈ìur.**
*Voc√™ √© minha alma g√™mea.*

"√Çme s≈ìur" √© a express√£o francesa para alma g√™mea - profunda e significativa.

**Je t'aime plus chaque jour.**
*Eu te amo mais a cada dia.*

Simples, direta e eternamente rom√¢ntica.

## Notas de Pron√∫ncia

O franc√™s tem sons desafiadores para lus√≥fonos:

- **"C≈ìur"** - /k≈ì Å/ - O som "≈ì" n√£o existe em portugu√™s, √© entre "e" e "o"
- **"Yeux"** - /j√∏/ - Som nasal caracter√≠stico
- **"Magnifique"** - /ma…≤ifik/ - O "gn" soa como "nh"

## Cultura do Flerte Franc√™s

Os franceses apreciam sutileza e intelig√™ncia no flerte. Diferente de culturas mais diretas, o jogo de sedu√ß√£o franc√™s envolve:

- **Conversa inteligente** - Demonstre cultura e wit
- **Contato visual** - Olhares prolongados s√£o parte do jogo
- **Paci√™ncia** - O flerte franc√™s √© uma dan√ßa, n√£o uma corrida

## O Poder do "Je ne sais quoi"

Esta express√£o famosa ("eu n√£o sei o qu√™") captura a ess√™ncia do charme franc√™s - aquele algo indefin√≠vel que torna algu√©m irresist√≠vel. Ao flertar em franc√™s, voc√™ automaticamente ganha um pouco desse mist√©rio.

## Comece Hoje

Envie um "Je pensais √† toi" (Estava pensando em voc√™) para seu amor. O franc√™s adiciona uma camada de sofistica√ß√£o a qualquer mensagem rom√¢ntica. Mesmo que sua pron√∫ncia n√£o seja perfeita, o esfor√ßo ser√° apreciado e considerado extremamente charmoso.

L'amour n'a pas de fronti√®res - o amor n√£o tem fronteiras. Deixe o franc√™s ser sua ponte para momentos inesquec√≠veis.

articles.title: Swedish Daily Conversations for Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Living with a Swedish partner gives you the perfect opportunity to practice this beautiful Scandinavian language daily. From morning fika to cozy evening hygge, this guide covers all the essential phrases for your life together.

## Start the Day Right

<PhraseOfDay
  word="God morgon, √§lskling"
  translation="Good morning, darling"
  pronunciation="good MOR-gon, ELSH-kling"
  context="The sweetest way to start each day with your Swedish partner."
/>

### Morning Greetings

<VocabCard
  word="Hur sov du?"
  translation="How did you sleep?"
  pronunciation="hoor soov doo?"
  example="Ask your partner about their night."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag sov bra"
  translation="I slept well"
  pronunciation="yah soov bra"
  example="Responding to the question."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag hade en fin dr√∂m"
  translation="I had a nice dream"
  pronunciation="yah HA-de en feen drum"
  example="Share your dreams!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vill du ha kaffe?"
  translation="Would you like coffee?"
  pronunciation="vil doo ha KA-fe?"
  example="Offer your partner their morning drink."
/>

<CultureTip title="Swedish Fika" flag="üá∏üá™">
"Fika" is a sacred Swedish tradition - a coffee break with something sweet. Morning fika together is a wonderful way to start the day. It's not just about coffee; it's about taking time to connect.
</CultureTip>

## Breakfast Time

<VocabCard
  word="Vad vill du ha till frukost?"
  translation="What would you like for breakfast?"
  pronunciation="vad vil doo ha til FROO-kost?"
  example="Planning breakfast together."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag ar hungrig"
  translation="I'm hungry"
  pronunciation="yah air HOONG-ri"
  example="Express your hunger."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag fixar frukost at dig"
  translation="I'll make you breakfast"
  pronunciation="yah FIK-sar FROO-kost oht dey"
  example="A sweet morning gesture."
/>

| Swedish | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Br√∂d** | brud | Bread |
| **Sm√∂r** | smur | Butter |
| **Sylt** | soolt | Jam |
| **√Ñgg** | egg | Eggs |
| **Yoghurt** | YOH-goort | Yogurt |
| **Kaffe** | KA-fe | Coffee |
| **Te** | tay | Tea |

## Leaving for Work

<VocabCard
  word="Jag maste ga till jobbet"
  translation="I have to go to work"
  pronunciation="yah MOS-te goh til YOB-et"
  example="Time to leave."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nar kommer du hem?"
  translation="When will you be home?"
  pronunciation="nair KOM-er doo hem?"
  example="Planning your evening."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag ar hemma vid sex"
  translation="I'll be home at six"
  pronunciation="yah air HEM-ma vid seks"
  example="Answering the question."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ha en fin dag!"
  translation="Have a nice day!"
  pronunciation="ha en feen dag!"
  example="A sweet farewell."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag kommer att sakna dig"
  translation="I'll miss you"
  pronunciation="yah KOM-er at SAK-na dey"
  example="Express affection before parting."
/>

## During the Day - Texting

<VocabCard
  word="Hur gar dagen?"
  translation="How's your day going?"
  pronunciation="hoor gohr DA-gen?"
  example="Check in with your partner."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag tanker pa dig"
  translation="I'm thinking of you"
  pronunciation="yah TEN-ker poh dey"
  example="A sweet midday message."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag langtar efter dig"
  translation="I miss you / I long for you"
  pronunciation="yah LENG-tar EF-ter dey"
  example="Express anticipation."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vad vill du ata till middag?"
  translation="What would you like for dinner?"
  pronunciation="vad vil doo OH-ta til mi-DAG?"
  example="Plan dinner together."
/>

<CultureTip title="Swedish Work-Life Balance" flag="üá∏üá™">
Sweden is known for excellent work-life balance. Many workplaces have "fika" breaks, and leaving work on time is the norm, not the exception. Your Swedish partner likely values quality time after work!
</CultureTip>

## Coming Home

<VocabCard
  word="Jag ar hemma!"
  translation="I'm home!"
  pronunciation="yah air HEM-ma!"
  example="Announce your arrival."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hur var jobbet?"
  translation="How was work?"
  pronunciation="hoor var YOB-et?"
  example="Ask about their day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det var stressigt"
  translation="It was stressful"
  pronunciation="det var STRE-sit"
  example="Share about a hard day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Kom hit, ge mig en kram"
  translation="Come here, give me a hug"
  pronunciation="kom heet, yay mey en kram"
  example="Welcome your partner home."
/>

## Evening Routine

### Dinner Time

<VocabCard
  word="Middagen ar klar"
  translation="Dinner is ready"
  pronunciation="mi-DA-gen air klahr"
  example="Call your partner to eat."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Smaklig maltid!"
  translation="Enjoy your meal!"
  pronunciation="SMAK-li MOHL-teed!"
  example="Say before eating."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det ar jattegott!"
  translation="It's very delicious!"
  pronunciation="det air YET-e-got!"
  example="Compliment the cooking."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag diskar"
  translation="I'll do the dishes"
  pronunciation="yah DIS-kar"
  example="Offer to help clean up."
/>

### Relaxing Together

<VocabCard
  word="Vad ska vi g√∂ra ikv√§ll?"
  translation="What shall we do this evening?"
  pronunciation="vad ska vee YU-ra i-KVELL?"
  example="Plan your evening."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ska vi titta pa en film?"
  translation="Shall we watch a movie?"
  pronunciation="ska vee TI-ta poh en film?"
  example="Suggest a movie night."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Kom och sitt bredvid mig"
  translation="Come and sit next to me"
  pronunciation="kom ok sit bred-VEED mey"
  example="Invite closeness."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vi kan bara prata"
  translation="We can just talk"
  pronunciation="vee kan BA-ra PRA-ta"
  example="Quality time together."
/>

<CultureTip title="Mys and Fredagsmys" flag="üá∏üá™">
"Mys" means coziness, similar to Danish "hygge." "Fredagsmys" (Friday cozy) is a Swedish tradition of relaxing on Friday evenings with snacks, movies, and loved ones. Create your own mys moments together!
</CultureTip>

## Household Tasks

<VocabCard
  word="Kan du hj√§lpa mig?"
  translation="Can you help me?"
  pronunciation="kan doo YEL-pa mey?"
  example="Ask for assistance."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag maste st√§da"
  translation="I need to clean"
  pronunciation="yah MOS-te STE-da"
  example="Household chores."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag gar och handlar"
  translation="I'm going shopping"
  pronunciation="yah gohr ok HAND-lar"
  example="Running errands."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vi beh√∂ver..."
  translation="We need..."
  pronunciation="vee be-HU-ver..."
  example="Making a shopping list."
/>

| Swedish | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Tv√§tta** | TVET-ta | To do laundry |
| **Dammsuga** | DAM-soo-ga | To vacuum |
| **Laga mat** | LA-ga mat | To cook |
| **Diska** | DIS-ka | To wash dishes |
| **St√§da** | STE-da | To clean |

## Weekend Plans

<VocabCard
  word="Vad ska vi g√∂ra i helgen?"
  translation="What shall we do this weekend?"
  pronunciation="vad ska vee YU-ra ee HEL-gen?"
  example="Plan your weekend."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ska vi ga ut n√•nstans?"
  translation="Shall we go out somewhere?"
  pronunciation="ska vee goh oot NOHN-stans?"
  example="Suggest going out."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vi skulle kunna..."
  translation="We could..."
  pronunciation="vee SKOO-le KOO-na..."
  example="Make suggestions."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det later bra!"
  translation="That sounds good!"
  pronunciation="det LOH-ter bra!"
  example="Agree enthusiastically."
/>

## Bedtime

<VocabCard
  word="Jag ar tr√∂tt"
  translation="I'm tired"
  pronunciation="yah air trut"
  example="Express tiredness."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ska vi ga och l√§gga oss?"
  translation="Shall we go to bed?"
  pronunciation="ska vee goh ok LEG-a os?"
  example="Suggest bedtime."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="God natt, √§lskling"
  translation="Good night, darling"
  pronunciation="good nat, ELSH-kling"
  example="Say goodnight sweetly."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sov gott"
  translation="Sleep well"
  pronunciation="soov got"
  example="Wish them good sleep."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dr√∂m s√∂tt"
  translation="Sweet dreams"
  pronunciation="drum sut"
  example="Before falling asleep."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jag √§lskar dig"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="yah EL-skar dey"
  example="The perfect way to end the day."
/>

## Quick Reference: Daily Phrases

### Morning
| Swedish | English |
|---------|---------|
| God morgon | Good morning |
| Hur sov du? | How did you sleep? |
| Vill du ha kaffe? | Want coffee? |
| Ha en fin dag | Have a nice day |

### During the Day
| Swedish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jag tanker pa dig | Thinking of you |
| Hur gar dagen? | How's your day? |
| Jag langtar efter dig | I miss you |
| Nar kommer du hem? | When will you be home? |

### Evening
| Swedish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jag ar hemma | I'm home |
| Hur var jobbet? | How was work? |
| Smaklig maltid | Enjoy your meal |
| Vad ska vi g√∂ra? | What shall we do? |

### Night
| Swedish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jag ar tr√∂tt | I'm tired |
| God natt | Good night |
| Sov gott | Sleep well |
| Jag √§lskar dig | I love you |

<CTA />
